intro: Stenia caudata, commonly known as the long-tailed stenia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with four petals, and are arranged in clusters. Stenia caudata is often found in grassland and woodland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
